name: angus
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
an area of northeastern Scotland that was a county until 1975 and is now a council area (= an area with its own local government): Much of Angus is taken up by fertile farmland, famous for fruit-growing and for Aberdeen Angus cattle.
More examplesFewer examplesAngus Council has become the latest local authority to join the Scottish Wide Area Network (SWAN).We recently set out our five-year vision for Angus with many exciting initiatives to take forward our ambitions for the county.The Angus or Aberdeen Angus breed is among the top three most common beef cattle breeds in the country. On the southern flank of the Highlands, the Angus Glens are a hidden part of Scotland.
